data.enText: beat
beaten
in game

data.chText: （在比赛或竞争中）赢，打败（某人）
data.enText: to defeat sb in a game or competition
He beat me at chess.

data.chText: 他们最近的胜利已证明，他们仍然是最难打败的队。
data.enText: Their recent wins have proved they're still the ones to beat (= the most difficult team to beat) .
control
to get control of sth

data.chText: 政府的主要目标是抑制通货膨胀。
data.enText: The government's main aim is to beat inflation.
be too difficult
to be too difficult for sb

data.chText: 连专家都难以解决的问题
data.enText: a problem that beats even the experts

data.chText: 我弄不懂他为什么这样做。
data.enText: It beats me (= I don't know) why he did it.

data.chText: 使我困惑不解的是，这事怎么这么快就完成了。
data.enText: What beats me is how it was done so quickly (= I don't understand how) .
be better
to do or be better than sth

data.chText: 什么也比不上家里做的好吃。
data.enText: Nothing beats home cooking.

data.chText: 意大利鞋是无与伦比的。
data.enText: You can't beat Italian shoes.

data.chText: 他们想打破这一速度纪录。
data.enText: They want to beat the speed record (= go faster than anyone before) .
avoid
to avoid sth

data.chText: 我们早点出发就会避开交通拥挤。
data.enText: If we go early we should beat the traffic.

data.chText: 我们很早就起床出发了，趁天还没热。
data.enText: We were up and off early to beat the heat .
hit
to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard
Somebody was beating at the door.

data.chText: 冰雹不断地砸在窗户上。
data.enText: Hailstones beat against the window.
Someone was beating a drum.

data.chText: 她正在拍掉地毯上的灰尘。
data.enText: She was beating dust out of the carpet (= removing dust from the carpet by beating it) .

data.chText: 有人发现一名老翁被打死了。
data.enText: An elderly man was found beaten to death .

data.chText: 那时候孩子们常常因为很小的过错而挨打。
data.enText: At that time children were regularly beaten for quite minor offences (= a punishment) .

data.chText: 他们把他打得不省人事。
data.enText: They beat him unconscious (= hit him until he became unconscious) .
of heart/drums/wings
to make, or cause sth to make, a regular sound or movement

data.chText: 她没死——她的心脏还在跳动。
data.enText: She's alive─her heart is still beating .
We heard the drums beating .
The bird was beating its wings (= moving them up and down) frantically.
mix
to mix sth with short quick movements with a fork, etc.

data.chText: 把鸡蛋打成黏稠泡沫状。
data.enText: Beat the eggs up to a frothy consistency.

data.chText: 把面粉和牛奶搅拌在一起。
data.enText: Beat the flour and milk together.
shape metal
to change the shape of sth, especially metal, by hitting it with a hammer , etc.
beaten silver

data.chText: 金子被锤打成了薄薄的长条。
data.enText: The gold is beaten out into thin strips.
The metal had been beaten flat.
make path
to make a path, etc. by walking somewhere or by pressing branches down and walking over them

data.chText: 经过很多人踏出来的路
data.enText: a well-beaten track (= one that has been worn hard by much use)

data.chText: 猎人们在灌木丛中踩出了一条小径。
data.enText: The hunters beat a path through the undergrowth.
beat about the bush
beat around the bush

data.chText: 拐弯抹角地讲话；绕圈子
data.enText: to talk about sth for a long time without coming to the main point

data.chText: 别绕来绕去了，告诉我你想要什么吧。
data.enText: Stop beating about the bush and tell me what you want.
beat sb at their own game

data.chText: 赢某人的看家本领；打败某人的强项
data.enText: to defeat or do better than sb in an activity which they have chosen or in which they think they are strong
beat your brains out
to think very hard about sth for a long time
beat your breast

data.chText: 捶胸顿足（尤指对自己的作为刻意表示悲伤或愧疚）
data.enText: to show that you feel sorry about sth that you have done, especially in public and in an exaggerated way
beat the clock

data.chText: 提前完成任务（或跑到终点等）
data.enText: to finish a task, race, etc. before a particular time
beat it
to go away immediately
This is private land, so beat it!
beat a path to sb's door

data.chText: 使门庭若市；蜂拥而至；使成注意焦点
data.enText: if a lot of people beat a path to sb's door , they are all interested in sth that person has to sell, or can do or tell them

data.chText: 顶尖级戏剧演员代理人正纷纷把目光投向那个十多岁的孩子。
data.enText: Top theatrical agents are beating a path to the teenager's door.
beat the rap
to escape without being punished
beat a (hasty) retreat
to go away or back quickly, especially to avoid sth unpleasant
beat time (to sth)
to mark or follow the rhythm of music, by waving a stick, tapping your foot, etc.
She beat time with her fingers.
beat sb to the punch
to get or do sth before sb else can
can you beat that/it!
used to express surprise or anger
if you can't beat them, join them
if you cannot defeat sb or be as successful as they are, then it is more sensible to join them in what they are doing and perhaps get some advantage for yourself by doing so
off the beaten track
far away from other people, houses, etc.
They live miles off the beaten track.
a rod/stick to beat sb with

data.chText: 用以责备或惩罚某人的事实依据（或把柄等）
data.enText: a fact, an argument, etc. that is used in order to blame or punish sb
take some beating
to be difficult to beat
That score is going to take some beating.

data.chText: 单看豪华的程度，这家旅馆是难以超越的。
data.enText: For sheer luxury, this hotel takes some beating.
(beat sb) black and blue

data.chText: （把某人打得）青一块紫一块，伤痕斑斑
data.enText: (to hit sb until they are) covered with bruises (= blue, brown or purple marks on the body)
beat/knock the (living) daylights out of sb
to hit sb very hard several times and hurt them very much
beat/bang the drum (for sb/sth)
to speak with enthusiasm in support of sb/sth
beat sth↔down
to hit a door, etc. many times until it breaks open
beat down (on sb/sth)
if the sun beats down it shines with great heat
beat sb/sth down (to sth)
to persuade sb to reduce the price at which they are selling sth

data.chText: 他那辆汽车要价8 000元，但我压到了6 000元。
data.enText: He wanted $8 000 for the car but I beat him down to $6 000.
I beat down the price to $6 000.
beat off
to masturbate
beat sb/sth↔off
to force sb/sth back or away by fighting
The attacker was beaten off.

data.chText: 她战胜了对她的领导地位的挑战。
data.enText: She beat off a challenge to her leadership.
beat sth↔out
to produce a rhythm by hitting sth many times
to put a fire out by beating
We beat the flames out.
to remove sth by hitting it with a hammer , etc.

data.chText: 他们能把汽车挡泥板上的凹痕敲平。
data.enText: They can beat out the dent in the car's wing.
beat sb out of sth
to cheat sb by taking sth from them
Her brother beat her out of $200.
beat sb to sth/…
beat sb to it
to get somewhere or do sth before sb else
She beat me to the top of the hill.

data.chText: 我正要拿那最后一块饼，却给他抢先一步。
data.enText: I was about to take the last cake, but he beat me to it.
beat sb↔up
to hit or kick sb hard, many times

data.chText: 他被一帮暴徒打得遍体鳞伤。
data.enText: He was badly beaten up by a gang of thugs.
beat up on sb
to hit sb hard, especially sb who is young or weak

data.chText: 我听说他以前常打妻子。
data.enText: I've heard people say he used to beat up on his wife.
beat yourself up (about/over sth)
to blame yourself too much for sth

data.chText: 听我说，没有必要为此过分自责。
data.enText: Look, there's no need to beat yourself up over this.
of drums/heart/wings

data.chText: （鼓的）一击；（翅的）一振；（心脏等的）跳动；击鼓声；振翅声；跳动声
data.enText: a single blow to sth, such as a drum, or a movement of sth, such as your heart; the sound that this makes
several loud beats on the drum

data.chText: 在见到她的一刹那，他的心跳顿了一下。
data.enText: His heart missed a beat when he saw her.
a series of regular blows to sth, such as a drum; the sound that this makes
the steady beat of the drums
rhythm
the main rhythm, or a unit of rhythm, in a piece of music, a poem, etc.
This type of music has a strong beat to it.
The piece has four beats to the bar.
of police officer
the area which a police officer walks around regularly and which he or she is responsible for

data.chText: 增加巡逻的警察可能有助于减少罪行。
data.enText: More police officers out on the beat may help to cut crime.
walk the beat
to walk around the area that they are responsible for

data.text: beat ♦ batter ♦ pound ♦ pummel ♦ lash ♦ hammer

data.chText: 以上各词均含反复敲打之义，尤指使劲地击打。
data.enText: All these words mean to hit sb/sth many times, especially hard.
beat
to hit sb/sth a lot of times, especially very hard
Someone was beating at the door.

data.chText: 昨天夜里有人发现一名小伙子被打死了。
data.enText: A young man was found beaten to death last night.

data.chText: 那时候，孩子们常常因为很小的过错而挨打。
data.enText: At that time, children were often beaten for quite minor offences (= as a punishment) .
batter

data.chText: 指连续猛击，尤指殴打致伤或造成破坏：
data.enText: to hit sb/sth hard a lot of times, especially in a way that causes serious damage
He had been badly battered around the head and face.
Severe winds have been battering the coast.
pound

data.chText: 指连续猛击，尤指发出砰砰的撞击声：
data.enText: to hit sb/sth hard a lot of times, especially in a way that makes a lot of noise

data.chText: 暴雨砰砰砰地砸在屋顶上。
data.enText: Heavy rain pounded on the roof.
pummel
to hit sb/sth a lot of times, especially with your fists (= tightly closed hands)
lash
to hit sb/sth with a lot of force

data.chText: 雨点猛烈地打在窗户上。
data.enText: The rain lashed at the window.
The subject of lash is often rain , wind , hail , sea or waves .
hammer

data.chText: 指大声、猛烈地反复敲打、连续击打：
data.enText: to hit sb/sth hard a lot of times, in a way that is noisy or violent
He hammered the door with his fists.

data.chText: 这两个词意思差别不大，但pound有时指较匀速而稳定地击打；hammer更猛烈，且常用于比喻。
data.enText: There is not much difference in meaning between these two, but to pound is sometimes a steadier action. To hammer can be more violent and it is often used figuratively.
pound or hammer?
to beat/batter/pound/pummel/lash/hammer sb/sth with sth
to beat/batter/pound/lash/hammer against sth
to beat/batter/pound/hammer on sth
to beat/batter/hammer sth down
to beat/batter sb about/around the head
the rain/wind/hail/sea beats/batters/pounds/lashes (at) sth

means: (在比赛或竞争中)赢，打败(某人)

ex.chText: 她的心跳得很快。
ex.enText: Her heart is beating fast.

ex.chText: 鸟儿扑扇着翅膀。
ex.enText: The birds are beating their wings.

synonyms.bx: 尤指心脏有规律地跳动，或指鸟类有节奏地拍打翅膀。

ex.chText: 小鸟上下拍动着翅膀，想要飞起来。
ex.enText: The young bird fluttered her wings up and down, hoping to fly.

ex.chText: 蜜蜂在花丛中飞舞。
ex.enText: The bees are fluttering among the flowers.

synonyms.bx: 特指鸟儿或有翅膀的昆虫快速而轻轻地振动翅膀。

ex.chText: 他气得心脏怦怦直跳。
ex.enText: His heart pounded with anger.

ex.chText: 他气得猛拍桌子。
ex.enText: He pounded the table angrily.

ex.chText: 他在砰砰地敲门。
ex.enText: He was pounding on the door.

synonyms.bx: 指激动、生气、愤怒等时心脏剧烈地跳动；也指使劲地连续击打。

ex.chText: 他激动得心脏怦怦直跳。
ex.enText: His heart pulsated with excitement.

ex.chText: 她感觉自己的心在随着余震一起跳动。
ex.enText: She felt her heart pulsate with the aftershock.

ex.chText: 我们看到她脖子上的血管在跳动。
ex.enText: We could see the veins in her neck pulsating.

synonyms.bx: 指心脏、动脉等有规律地振动或有节奏地舒张和收缩。

ex.chText: 他吓得心怦怦直跳。
ex.enText: His heart thumped with fear.

ex.chText: 我的心开始狂跳起来。
ex.enText: My heart began to thump wildly.

synonyms.bx: 指因恐惧或激动而心脏怦怦直跳。

ex.chText: 在那场决定性战役中，我军击败了敌军。
ex.enText: Our army defeated the enemy in that decisive battle.

ex.chText: 这个球队将对手一一击败。
ex.enText: The team defeated their opponents.

synonyms.bx: 常指在战争、比赛、竞争等中战胜对手。

ex.chText: 阿森纳队以1比3告负。
ex.enText: The Arsenal were beaten/defeated, 3 - 1.

ex.chText: 保守党在选举中击败对手。
ex.enText: The Conservatives beat/defeated their opponents in the election.

synonyms.bx: 作此义解时，常可与 defeat 换用。

ex.chText: 她希望能彻底战胜对手。
ex.enText: She hoped that she could checkmate her opponents.

ex.chText: 王被将死，棋手输了这盘棋。
ex.enText: The king was checkmated and so the player lost the game.

synonyms.bx: 指彻底战败对手等；在国际象棋中也指把国王将死。

ex.chText: 谁先动手的?
ex.enText: Who struck the first blow?

ex.chText: 他用手杖打了那个男孩。
ex.enText: He struck the boy with his stick.

ex.chText: 音锤敲击钢琴琴弦并使之震动。
ex.enText: The hammers strike the piano strings and make them vibrate.

ex.chText: 海关大钟报时。
ex.enText: The huge clock at the Customs House strikes the hours.

synonyms.bx: 较正式用词，指迅速或突然地用力一击或敲击，可以是有意的，也可以是无意的。

ex.chText: 那可怜的孩子被打得青一块紫一块的。
ex.enText: The poor child was beaten black and blue.

ex.chText: 他们常被雇主打骂。
ex.enText: They were frequently cursed and beaten by the employer.

ex.chText: 杰克在游戏中战胜了乔布。
ex.enText: Jack beat Jobe to win the game.

ex.chText: 主队以大比分打败了客队。
ex.enText: The home team beat the visiting team by a large score.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指用手或器械连续击打，也指在游戏、竞赛或战争中战胜对手。

ex.chText: 导弹击中了航空母舰。
ex.enText: The missile hit the carrier.

ex.chText: 砖块击中了他的头部。
ex.enText: The brick hit him in the head.

ex.chText: 经济衰退使这家人遭到重创。
ex.enText: The economic recession hit the family hard.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，指有目标地猛击，强调用力击中；引申指在精神、经济等方面予以打击。

ex.chText: 袭击者把她打倒在地并狠狠地踢她。
ex.enText: The attacker knocked her to the ground and kicked her hard.

ex.chText: 有人在敲门。
ex.enText: Somebody is knocking on the door.

ex.chText: 我希望你不要再敲桌子了。
ex.enText: I wish you wouldn't knock at the table again.

synonyms.bx: 指用拳头或器械猛敲、猛打，强调非常用力。

beat around the bush

data.chText: 用以责备或惩罚某人的事实依据（或把柄等）
data.enText: a fact, an argument, etc. that is used in order to blame or punish sb
take some beating

That score is going to take some beating.

data.chText: 单看豪华的程度，这家旅馆是难以超越的。
data.enText: For sheer luxury, this hotel takes some beating.
(beat sb) black and blue

data.chText: （把某人打得）青一块紫一块，伤痕斑斑
data.enText: (to hit sb until they are) covered with bruises (= blue, brown or purple marks on the body)
beat/knock the (living) daylights out of sb
to hit sb very hard several times and hurt them very much
beat/bang the drum (for sb/sth)
to speak with enthusiasm in support of sb/sth
beat/kick (the) hell out of sb/sth
knock hell out of sb/sth
to hit sb/sth very hard

data.chText: 他是个不讲体育道德的球员，喜欢猛力冲撞对方。
data.enText: He was a dirty player and loved to kick hell out of the opposition.
sb's heart misses a beat

data.chText: 心里咯噔一下（表示突然感到恐惧、兴奋等）
data.enText: used to say that sb has a sudden feeling of fear, excitement, etc.
walk the beat
to walk around the area that they are responsible for
beat sth↔down
to hit a door, etc. many times until it breaks open
beat down (on sb/sth)
if the sun beats down it shines with great heat
beat sb/sth down (to sth)
to persuade sb to reduce the price at which they are selling sth

data.chText: 他那辆汽车要价8 000元，但我压到了6 000元。
data.enText: He wanted $8 000 for the car but I beat him down to $6 000.
I beat down the price to $6 000.
beat off
to masturbate
beat sb/sth↔off
to force sb/sth back or away by fighting
The attacker was beaten off.

data.chText: 她战胜了对她的领导地位的挑战。
data.enText: She beat off a challenge to her leadership.
beat sth↔out
to produce a rhythm by hitting sth many times
to put a fire out by beating
We beat the flames out.
to remove sth by hitting it with a hammer , etc.

data.chText: 他们能把汽车挡泥板上的凹痕敲平。
data.enText: They can beat out the dent in the car's wing.
beat sb out of sth
to cheat sb by taking sth from them
Her brother beat her out of $200.
beat sb to sth/…
beat sb to it
to get somewhere or do sth before sb else
She beat me to the top of the hill.

data.chText: 我正要拿那最后一块饼，却给他抢先一步。
data.enText: I was about to take the last cake, but he beat me to it.
beat sb↔up
to hit or kick sb hard, many times

data.chText: 他被一帮暴徒打得遍体鳞伤。
data.enText: He was badly beaten up by a gang of thugs.
beat up on sb
to hit sb hard, especially sb who is young or weak

data.chText: 我听说他以前常打妻子。
data.enText: I've heard people say he used to beat up on his wife.
beat yourself up (about/over sth)

data.chText: 听我说，没有必要为此过分自责。
data.enText: Look, there's no need to beat yourself up over this.

tr: the act of beating to windward
sailing as close as possible to the direction from which the wind is blowing
a stroke or blow
example: the signal was two beats on the steam pipe

tr: a regular rate of repetition
the basic rhythmic unit in a piece of music
example: the piece has a fast rhythm

tr: (prosody) the accent in a metrical foot of verse
the sound of stroke or blow
example: he heard the beat of a drum

tr: the rhythmic contraction and expansion of the arteries with each beat of the heart
example: he could feel the beat of her heart

tr: a regular route for a sentry or policeman
example: in the old days a policeman walked a beat and knew all his people by name

tr: a member of the beat generation
a nonconformist in dress and behavior
a single pulsation of an oscillation produced by adding two waves of different frequencies
has a frequency equal to the difference between the two oscillations
wear out completely
example: This kind of work exhausts me
He was all washed up after the exam

tr: be a mystery or bewildering to
example: Got me--I don't know the answer!

tr: come out better in a competition, race, or conflict
example: Agassi beat Becker in the tennis championship
Harvard defeated Yale in the last football game

tr: beat through cleverness and wit
give a beating to
subject to a beating, either as a punishment or as an act of aggression
example: Thugs beat him up when he walked down the street late at night
The teacher used to beat the students

tr: hit repeatedly
example: beat the table with his shoe

tr: strike (water or bushes) repeatedly to rouse animals for hunting
strike (a part of one's own body) repeatedly, as in great emotion or in accompaniment to music
stir vigorously
shape by beating
produce a rhythm by striking repeatedly
make by pounding or trampling
example: beat a path through the forest

tr: move with or as if with a regular alternating motion
example: the city pulsated with music and excitement

tr: move rhythmically
indicate by beating, as with the fingers or drumsticks
sail with much tacking or with difficulty
example: The boat beat in the strong wind

tr: move with a flapping motion
move with a thrashing motion
example: The eagle beat its wings and soared high into the sky

tr: glare or strike with great intensity
example: The sun was beating down on us

tr: make a rhythmic sound
make a sound like a clock or a timer
avoid paying
be superior

value.boxr_value: The form beat is used in the present tense and is the past tense. beat 的过去式与原形相同。

value.def: If you beat someone or something, you hit them very hard.

example.ex: My wife tried to stop them and they beat her...
example.tran: 我妻子想阻止他们，他们就打了她。

example.ex: They were beaten to death with baseball bats.
example.tran: 他们被人用棒球棒打死了。

value.def: To beat on, at, or against something means to hit it hard, usually several times or continuously for a period of time.

example.ex: There was dead silence but for a fly beating against the glass...
example.tran: 当时一片寂静，只听见一只苍蝇不停地撞击着玻璃。

example.ex: Nina managed to free herself and began beating at the flames with a pillow...
example.tran: 尼娜好不容易挣脱出来，拿起枕头用力扑打火焰。

example.ex: The rain was beating on the windowpanes.
example.tran: 雨点拍打着窗玻璃。

example.ex: ...the rhythmic beat of the surf.
example.tran: 海浪有节奏的拍打

value.tran: （通常指多次或连续地）撞击，猛撞，拍打

example.ex: ...the silence broken only by the beating of the rain.
example.tran: 一片寂静，只听见雨声

value.def: When your heart or pulse beats, it continually makes regular rhythmic movements.

example.ex: I felt my heart beating faster.
example.tran: 我感觉我的心越跳越快。

example.ex: He could hear the beat of his heart...
example.tran: 他能听见自己的心跳声。

example.ex: Most people's pulse rate is more than 70 beats per minute.
example.tran: 大多数人的脉率都在每分钟70次以上。

example.ex: I could hear the beating of my heart.
example.tran: 我能听见自己的心跳。

value.def: If you beat a drum or similar instrument, you hit it in order to make a sound. You can also say that a drum beats .

example.ex: When you beat the drum, you feel good.
example.tran: 敲鼓的时候感觉很好。

example.ex: ...drums beating and pipes playing.
example.tran: 敲鼓和吹风笛

example.ex: ...the rhythmical beat of the drum.
example.tran: 有节奏的鼓点

value.def: The beat of a piece of music is the main rhythm that it has.

example.ex: ...the thumping beat of rock music.
example.tran: 摇滚乐强烈的节奏

example.ex: ...the dance beats of the last two decades.
example.tran: 过去20年的舞曲节奏

value.def: In music, a beat is a unit of measurement. The number of beats in a bar of a piece of music is indicated by two numbers at the beginning of the piece.

example.ex: It's got four beats to a bar.
example.tran: 一个小节有4拍。

value.def: If you beat eggs, cream, or butter, you mix them thoroughly using a fork or beater.

example.ex: Beat the eggs and sugar until they start to thicken.
example.tran: 把鸡蛋和白糖混在一起搅打至开始变稠。

value.def: When a bird or insect beats its wings or when its wings beat, its wings move up and down.

example.ex: Beating their wings they flew off...
example.tran: 它们拍打着翅膀飞走了。

example.ex: Its wings beat slowly.
example.tran: 它的翅膀缓慢拍动着。

value.tran: 拍打，拍动（翅膀）；（翅膀）拍动

value.def: If you beat someone in a competition or election, you defeat them.

example.ex: In yesterday's games, Switzerland beat the United States two-one...
example.tran: 在昨天的比赛中，瑞士以2比1击败美国。

example.ex: There are men who simply don't like being beaten by a woman...
example.tran: 有些男人就是不想被女人打败。

example.ex: She was easily beaten into third place.
example.tran: 她轻易落败，跌至第三。

value.def: If someone beats a record or achievement, they do better than it.

example.ex: He was as eager as his Captain to beat the record.
example.tran: 他和队长一样渴望打破这项纪录。

value.tran: 打破（纪录等）；超过； 突破

value.def: If you beat something that you are fighting against, for example an organization, a problem, or a disease, you defeat it.

example.ex: It became clear that the Union was not going to beat the government...
example.tran: 情况已然明朗，工会无法和政府抗衡。

example.ex: They recognise that tough action offers the only hope of beating inflation...
example.tran: 他们认识到这一严厉举措是战胜通货膨胀的唯一希望。

example.ex: Kate Jackson is expecting her first child at 43—two years after beating breast cancer.
example.tran: 凯特·杰克逊在43岁的时候怀上了第一个孩子——那时她战胜乳腺癌已经有两年了。

value.tran: 战胜（某个组织、问题、疾病等）

value.def: If an attack or an attempt is beaten off or is beaten back, it is stopped, often temporarily.

example.ex: The rescuers were beaten back by strong winds and currents...
example.tran: 救援人员因风浪太大而被迫中断工作。

example.ex: South Africa's  ruling National Party has beaten off a right-wing challenge.
example.tran: 南非执政的国民党已经击退了右翼分子的一次挑战。

value.def: If you say that one thing beats another, you mean that it is better than it.

example.ex: Being boss of a software firm beats selling insurance...
example.tran: 当软件公司的老板比卖保险强多了。

example.ex: Nothing quite beats the luxury of soaking in a long, hot bath at the end of a tiring day...
example.tran: 辛苦一天之后美美地泡个热水澡比什么都强。

example.ex: For an evening stroll the beach at Dieppe is hard to beat.
example.tran: 傍晚散步去迪耶普的海滩简直是不二之选。

value.def: If you say you can't beat a particular thing you mean that it is the best thing of its kind.

example.ex: You can't beat soap and water for cleansing.
example.tran: 做清洁没有比用肥皂和水更好的了。

value.tran: 没有比…更好的；什么也比不上；最好的莫过于

value.def: To beat a time limit or an event means to achieve something before that time or event.

example.ex: They were trying to beat the midnight deadline...
example.tran: 他们要努力赶在午夜的最后期限之前完成。

example.ex: Those who shop on Sunday to beat the rush are wasting their time.
example.tran: 那些为了在抢购高峰前下手而在星期天购物的人是在浪费时间。

value.def: A police officer's or journalist's beat is the area for which he or she is responsible.

example.ex: The team police get to know the people in their patrol areas better than cops who must cover a larger beat.
example.tran: 小分队的警察比那些负责大片区域的警察更了解自己管片的群众。

value.tran: （警察的）辖区，巡逻区；（记者的）负责采访的区域

value.def: You use beat in expressions such as 'It beats me' or 'What beats me is' to indicate that you cannot understand or explain something.

example.ex: 'What am I doing wrong, anyway?' — 'Beats me, Lewis.'...
example.tran: “不管怎样，我到底做错了什么？”——“这我也不知道，刘易斯。”

example.ex: How you can be so insensitive absolutely beats me.
example.tran: 我真搞不懂你怎么会这么麻木。

value.tran: 把…难住；使不明白；使无法解释

value.def: If you tell someone to beat it, you are telling them to go away.

example.ex: Beat it before it's too late.
example.tran: 趁早滚开。

value.def: You can say Can you beat it? or Can you beat that? to show that you are surprised and perhaps annoyed about something.

example.ex: Can you beat it; there was Graham Greene in Freetown and there was I on the other side of Africa.
example.tran: 真是岂有此理！格雷厄姆·格林在弗里敦，而我却在非洲的另一边。

value.tran: （表示惊讶或恼怒）竟然有这种事？岂有此理！

value.def: If you intend to do something but someone beats you to it, they do it before you do.

example.ex: Don't  be too long about it or you'll find someone has beaten you to it.
example.tran: 别拖得太久，不然就会有人捷足先登了。

value.tran: 比…抢先行动；赶在…前面（做某事）

value.def: If you can't beat them, join them means that, if someone is too strong for you to defeat, it is better to be on the same side as them.
If you say or do something without missing a beat, you continue to speak or do it, even though people might have expected you to hesitate or stop.

example.ex: 'Are you jealous?' — 'Only when I'm not in control,' he says, not missing a beat.
example.tran: “你眼红吗？”——“除非我把持不住自己，”他毫不犹豫地说道。

value.def: If you say that someone never misses a beat, you mean that they always know what is going on and how they can take advantage of it.

example.ex: Skye has scarcely missed a beat as one of the Gold Coast's spectacular models since her marriage.
example.tran: 丝凯作为黄金海岸大红大紫的模特儿，自结婚以后从来就没有错失过任何机会。

value.def: A police officer on the beat is on duty, walking around the area for which he or she is responsible.

example.ex: The officer on the beat picks up information; hears cries for help; makes people feel safe.
example.tran: 值勤警员注意观察情况，对救援呼叫及时反应，确保让百姓有一种安全感。

value.def: If you beat time to a piece of music, you move your hand or foot up and down in time with the music. A conductor beats time to show the choir or orchestra how fast they should sing or play the music.

example.ex: He beats time with hands and feet.
example.tran: 他手脚并用地打着拍子。

xrse.def: to beat or knock the living daylights out of someone
to beat the drum for someone or something
to beat someone at their own game

xrse.xrse_see: retreat;kick or knock the shit out of someone

xrse.def: a stick to beat someone with

example.ex: There had been no violence, no beatings-up until then.
example.tran: 在那之前没有动粗打人。

trans: 意想不到；压倒一切；了不起
在某件事上占某人之先
击败；（太阳）暴晒，强烈地照射；（雨）滂沱而下，倾盆而下；压低（卖主要价）
痛打；殴打；（对…）忧心忡忡；（因为…而）自责
（用鼓等乐器）敲奏出；（用毯子等）扑灭（火）；打败；击败；战胜
搅入（某物）；强行灌输（知识等）；把（某人）打伤；把（某物）砸坏
以强节奏演奏爵士音乐；逃跑
四处拍打；掉转船头；改变航向；焦急搜索，找寻
垮掉的一代(指20世纪50年代和60年代初期拒绝主流生活方式、追求个性自我表现、欣赏现代爵士乐的一批年轻人)
经常巡逻的路线；（无线电）拍频；差频
